metadata.title: CVE-2022-30522 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
If Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 is configured to do transformations withmod_sed in contexts where the input to mod_sed may be very large, mod_sedmay make excessively large memory allocations and trigger an abort.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.25
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.25
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.25
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.25
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.25
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.25
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.25').
